name: Hilton Garden Inn Austin / Round Rock

reviews.title: Great hotel for a 3 star
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for free with Hilton points - what a deal! Nice rooms, comfy beds, and $5 breakfast (we didn't try it, but it smelled good). Great location right by Chuys and shopping, and the freeway. Only complaint is the noisy people down the hall decided they needed to conversate for 10 minutes while I was trying to sleep, but that's not really the hotel's fault.
Great Stay at the Garden Inn! Clean room, very comfortable bed, close to I-35 and area restaurants. Will stay there again!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: I have stayed in a few hotels in this area and they were all nice. They are all priced about the same. I did not expect what I got at this hotel. The bed is very comfortable with plenty of pillows. The chair is comfortable with a foot stool. The desk is very business orientated. The bathroom is nice. The room came with hd tv, micro, frig and coffeemaker. Breakfast was good and we had a package where you get free full breakfast. Had the texas french toast and omelet. Both were very tastey. The staff is very friendly and always asking if you need anything.
reviews.title: beautiful rooms

reviews.text: Our stay this time at the Hilton was very disappointing. In the past, we have stayed here and were very satisfied, however, this stay was very different. There were sugar ants all over the night stands, around the coffee maker and coming out of the walls in the bathroom. There were also fleas that would jump on you around the sofa area. When I brought it to the attention of the staff, they seemed bothered, did not offer any regret, and just said that they have a monthly exterminator that comes each month. (which was obviously not working very well) The first night , the AC was great but when we got back from a game one day, the room would not cool down. Of course, they didn't have any rooms to move us to. The wallpaper on the walls were peeling off the walls, breakfast was way over-priced ($8.95/person) , and the housekeeping employees did not speak English. If you needed something (extra towels, toilet paper, or toiletries) then you needed someone that was bilingual to be able to communicate. Also, they put a lone man (that went to bed by 8 pm) on a floor with, and right in the middle of several baseball teams that were staying at the hotel. The planning of this was not wise because many of the teams came and went at various times and this man expected total silence......ain't gonna happen with high school baseball players after a game. It was unfortunate that our stay was so below average.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — Customer service from staff.....night shift black lady was great, Asian daytime lady was good , Samantha was very unpleasant when certain concerns were brought to her attention.....not very professional unlike other places that we have stayed at in the area.

reviews.title: Very nice place
reviews.text: I am a repeat customer here, have family in the area and some times my nephews stay with me. Very clean, great bed and pillows. All rooms have fridge and micro. At least 5 restaurants with in walking distance. Breakfast is superb. Staff is friendly and helpful. While the hot tub is nothing to write home about, the pool is nice and kids can get floating toys at the front desk. This hotel has become my home away from home. I'll be back. W. O. Dallas, TX

I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn in Round Rock for one night on business. It's a nice clean hotel. Seemed to be fairly new. I have no complaints to make. The staff was courteous. The room was clean and spacious. The hot breakfast was quite good. As with all Garden Inns, you pay for the breakfast unless you are a Gold HHonors or higher. The location is not ideal for the vacationer. I would stay in downtown Austin for that. But if you have business on the north side of Austin, I would certainly recommend this hotel. Free high speed internet access (wired) in the room. Wireless in the lobby. There is an outdoor pool, but I did not use it. Saw a fitness room but, again, did not use it.
reviews.title: No complaints, but nothing special

reviews.text: This is a typical Hilton Garden Inn with clean rooms. No problems with noise or internet connection. There are three restaurants just outside the hotel which was nice. The front desk and restaurant staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Good choice for business travelers

reviews.text: Very nice & clean hotel. Room is also clean and bedding was very nice & comfortable. It also has refrigerator (no freezer) and microwave in room.
reviews.title: Nice and Comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was very clean with a very courteous staff. The most important thing to me was the comfortable bed. It's an adjustable mattress. I have a back problem and MUST have a firm bed. Most hotels are now going to the more plush soft beds. I've had to check out of several in the past. Hilton-Gardens in Round Rock was PERFECT! Never slept better! I'm now trying to find out how to buy a mattress like theirs for my home. I'll definately stay again.
reviews.title: Great, Great, Great hotel

reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this hotel. I have stayed here many times over the past year. Never ANY disappointment. Front staff is great, especially Maria. Always a great smile and a terrific memory.
reviews.title: Only place to stay in RR

reviews.text: Room is comfortable. Location is close to great restaurants. If you are here try Chuy's for Tex-Mex. I would recommend this any time.
reviews.title: Great Beds

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Austin/Round Rock Hotel
description: Our Hilton Garden Inn Austin/Round Rock hotel is stylish and sophisticated, offering you easy access to the Round Rock shopping outlets. We offer complimentary WiFi and cooked to order breakfast to help you feel right at home.
